I can't predict the future of airlines' investment in the training of their flight attendants. 

however, it is essential to understand that airlines have a responsibility to ensure the safety and well-being of their passengers, and this includes providing their flight attendants with comprehensive training. safety regulations are in place that airlines must adhere to, and part of this compliance involves ensuring that their flight attendants are adequately trained to handle any emergencies or issues that may arise during a flight.

furthermore, flight attendants are also a vital aspect of the overall passenger experience, and airlines typically invest in customer service training to ensure their flight attendants can provide top-notch service.

while cost control is undoubtedly a critical aspect of any business, airlines must balance it with their commitment to safety and customer service, and this usually involves investing in training and development. investing in the training of their flight attendants can also help airlines to minimize liability and protect their reputation in the event of an incident.

therefore, it is likely that airlines will continue to invest in the training of their flight attendants to maintain the safety and satisfaction of their passengers, even if they are looking to save money.
